original: Fredenholm, Per Axel, redaktör, författare, Göteborg, f. 22/2/81 i An-derstorp, Jönköp. 1. G. 1. 09 m. Edla Hasselbllad; 2. 29 m. Karin Forssell. Barn: Axel Thord f. 11. — Jönköp. tekn. sk. 99, North Park College i Chicago 05, stud. v. fyra olika amer. univ. o. colleges, bachelor of Phiilo-sophy o. dr of Literature. Föret, om-fatt. res. i Amerika o. Europa. Red. f. California-Posten i Los Angeles, Calif., USA, 07-09, Swedish Pacific Press i Seattle, Wash., USA, 09-11, utg. av Österns Veckoblad i Wor-cester, Mass., USA, 12-19, i’är. o. und. två år rektor v. Karlskoga prakt, lärov. 21-26, arkivförest, i Gbg 37-45. Led. av Gbgs förf:säLlsk. m. fl. Hålll. omkr. 1000 föredr. o. föreläsn. i filosof. ämnen samt reseskildringar. Skr.: Svenskarna i Amerika (tills. m. dr Karl Hildebrand 26), Min väg o. min sång (40), Uppgörelse (45), Sång-offer i öknen (46), Sammanringning (46), Fri horisont (47) m. fl, gjort flera övers. fr. o. t. eng. språket. Hobbies : ländsk :målln. o. stud. i sanskrit, konst o. konststud. NyaSvM, inneh. flera uti. ordnar.
translated: Fredenholm, Per Axel, editor, author, Gothenburg, b. 22/2/81 in Anderstorp, Jönköping. 1st marriage in 1909 to Edla Hasselblad; 2nd marriage in 1929 to Karin Forssell. Children: Axel Thord b. 1911 - Jönköping Technical School 1999, North Park College in Chicago 1905, studied at four different American universities and colleges, received bachelor of Philosophy and doctor of Literature degrees. His business career spanned across America and Europe. He was an editor at California-Posten in Los Angeles, California, USA from 1907-1909, at Swedish Pacific Press in Seattle, Washington, USA from 1909-1911, and was the publisher of Österns Veckoblad in Worcester, Massachusetts, USA from 1912-1919. He was principal of Karlskoga Practical High School for almost two years from 1921-1926 and was an archive manager in Gothenburg from 1937-1945. He was a member of the Gothenburg Writers' Society and others. He gave around 1,000 lectures on philosophical topics as well as travelogues. He wrote: Svenskarna i Amerika (with Dr. Karl Hildebrand 1926), Min väg och min sång (1940), Uppgörelse (1945), Sångoffer i öknen (1946), Sammanringning (1946), Fri horisont (1947) and many others. He made several translations from and to the English language. His hobbies included studying Scandinavian languages and Sanskrit, art, and art studies. He received several awards for his work.
